title: If God deserves praise for a live saved then he deserves blame for a life lost

author: upfordebating
text:
Most people fail to understand that there is something greater going on than we can really grasp. God's character is on the line, and Satan has done his best, and still trying, to bring God down and smear His good name. God is loving and all-knowing (doesnt mean He makes peoplendo bad things or that is His fault), but sin has entered into this world, and that causes so much suffering, not God. There's a great controversy going on, and we are all a part of it. God is giving people a chance to see who He is and see who satan is.

One day, God will restore all to His original plan, removing the suffering and restoring everything to being perfect and without sin, but first, He is allowing the sin to play out in order to show His character and reveal satan's lies. God is love, which means He does not force anything or intervene without being invited. Yes, many babies and children suffer, but that isn't God's fault. That is due to someone else's sin.

author: Howling2021
text:
In the Hebrew traditions, which Jesus as a Jew was raised in, Satan was never evil, nor enemy to God or humankind. In their beliefs, angels and archangels weren't endowed with free will as humankind were. Lacking free will, even if the notion could even occur to one to disobey God, or rebel against God, they would be unable to do so, and compelled to do only the bidding of God.

Satan was set to this task...to place challenges and adversity in the paths of human beings, for the purpose of motivating them to rise to meet the challenges, overcome them, and increase in wisdom and understanding during their mortal lives. Satan was also there to observe silently, as he would also serve as prosecutor on the day of judgment.

The Hebrews believed that Satan was a great blessing which God had bestowed upon them, for these purposes.

I propose that it's the Roman Catholics who've smeared the good name of Satan, and their efforts were supported by the Protestants who believed the embellishments of the R.C.C. priests who taught that either heaven or hell were final destinations for human souls. Because in Hebrew belief, heaven was only the abode of God and His holy angels, and God didn't create a hell for eternal damnation and torture of human souls.

author: upfordebating
text:
I can't speak for others nor do i have to prove anything. I know my relationship with God and my faith. I know what I am learning more about Him every day. I understand what is going on; it simply makes sense to me. God is loving and is allowing actions to play out, and whatever happens, He is just in His judgment because He knows every heart. And I am trusting in Him so that I can see the day when all of this sin problem comes to an end.

author: upfordebating
text:
Then I will respond to your last point since that is interesting to you, but just like to comment on the being blinded part- I wasn't necessarily raised believing or not believing in God. I went through my own hardships of abuse and had a lot of hate for Him and was, at some point, atheist, so I'm not just blinded by one side of things because I grew up that way. These understandings take a lot of listening and thought and studies.

​

Oh and to comment on other religions, understanding when they began and how really shows a different light to them being right or wrong. But anyways.

The afterlife. Many people believe that when you die you go to heaven (or hell but no one really says that, may be though in a figure of speech "go to hell" etc. but people usually say they are looking down on us in heaven). That is not what the Bible teaches at all. I won't quote full verses; you can look them up if you would like. The Bible teaches that when you die, nothing happens. A person simply goes to the ground and their breath, literally the air they breathe, goes to God, just leaves their body. That is it. Job 14: 11-12; Job 7:9-10; Job 3: 17-19; Psalm 146:4; Ecc 12:7; 1 Thes 4:14-17; Ecc 9: 5-6; 10; Heb 9:27; Psalm 115:17; John 11:11-14;  There are more but that is enough to show what happens when you die. Notice how none of them address going to heaven or going to hell.

Then they are "asleep" (because one day they will wake up) and wake up to the resurrection day, whether it be to life or to death. You can read some of that here- 1 Thes 4: 14-17; Rev 20 (the entire chapter). When Jesus comes back for His children to take them to heaven, the dead in Christ will wake up and be taken up with Him and then those living go. Those who are not His children are killed by the brightness of His glory. (This is just me but I understand it by how pure and holy His glory is, that nothing defiled can live in it. ) So then for 1000 years there is a judgement taking place so that everyone of God's children can see why they are in heaven or why someone they loved/ knew didn't make it. Everyone's life is open to be reviewed so that we can know and understand that God is just and loving.

Afterward, He brings us back to the earth with the holy city, and satan has his last attempted at deceiving the people and provoking them to attack, showing again his true colors, but God protects His children and finally destroys satan and all those who did not make it, but they don't burn forever. The fire goes out and that ends all of their suffering. Malachi 4:1-3 also in revelation 20

Then God creates a new heaven and earth and His people live with Him for eternity.

​

You can look at this study here:  https://www.amazingfacts.org/media-library/study-guide/e/4989/t/1-000-years-of-peace)
